events.message: The customer reported a recent car collision that occurred on April 28th involving significant front-end damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorized as an Auto Accident based on the description referencing a vehicle collision.
A dedicated claims agent was assigned to assist the customer through the auto accident claim process.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and assured prompt follow-up.
The agent requested copies of the police report, pictures of vehicle damage, and a repair estimate from the customer.
The customer submitted all required documents including the police report, images of the collision site, and repair quotes.
The claims investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence to determine liability and assess the damage.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the customer’s vehicle was involved in a fault accident caused by another driver.
A settlement amount covering vehicle repairs and towing fees was proposed to the customer for approval.
The customer responded with appreciation for the timely communication and agreed to the settlement proposal.
The claim was formally approved and all necessary internal sign-offs were completed for the planned payment.
The insurance payment covering approved repairs and additional costs was processed and sent to the customer’s account.
The claims file was officially closed following completion of all financial transactions and confirmation from the customer.
